title: 111_hr4581
content: The Act is titled the "Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac Accountability and Transparency for Taxpayers Act of 2010." It requires quarterly reports during conservatorship. The "Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac Accountability and Transparency for Taxpayers Act of 2010" mandates quarterly reports during conservatorship. Covered officers must submit reports to Congress summarizing their activities and the condition of each enterprise, including details on liabilities and executive compensation. The quarterly reports mandated by the "Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac Accountability and Transparency for Taxpayers Act of 2010" require details on executive compensation, foreclosure mitigation activities, mortgage fraud prevention efforts, and related data for the enterprises during conservatorship. The curr_chunk provides details on activities, communication, investments, and equity investments of the enterprise during a specific period. It includes data on mortgage fraud prevention efforts, communication with regulatory bodies, and investments not aligned with the enterprise's mission. The curr_chunk details equity investments by the Department of the Treasury, capital levels, underwriting standards, and actions affecting security holders of the enterprise. The curr_chunk discusses reporting periods and timing of reports for enterprises under conservatorship, with specific deadlines for submission of required reports. The curr_chunk outlines reporting requirements for enterprises under receivership or nationalization, specifying deadlines for submission of reports. The covered officer must submit reports for enterprises under nationalization within consecutive 6-month periods, with the first period starting upon nationalization. Reports must be submitted within 60 days after each reporting period. The officer must make information public and provide contact information for reporting waste. The covered officer must submit reports for enterprises under nationalization within consecutive 6-month periods, starting upon nationalization. Reports must be submitted within 60 days after each period. Contact information for reporting waste must be publicized. Definitions for conservatorship period and covered officer are provided. The Housing and Community Development Act of 1992 outlines the appointment of officers for oversight, including an interim inspector general and the Associate Director for Internal Audit of the Federal Housing Finance Agency. The term "enterprise" refers to the Federal National Mortgage Association and the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation. The reporting period is defined as a period described in subsection (c).
